artefact: Register as a childminder for children up to 5 (England)

artefact.overview: If you want to become a childminder in England looking after children up to 5, you must register on the 'Early Years Register' with Ofsted
artefact.licence_short_description: If you want to provide childminding services in England for children up to 5 years old then you must be registered with Ofsted.
artefact.licence_overview:
$!You must register with Ofsted if you want to provide 'Early Years' childminding or day care services in England.$!

An 'Early Years' childminder is someone who gets paid for looking after children under 5:

* for more than 2 hours a day
* in a home that isn't the children's normal home

All the adults living or working at the home where you’re based must also register.

You don’t have to register to do babysitting.

^If you want to provide childminding to children up to 8 years old, you should [apply to join the Childcare Register](register-as-childminder-england) as well.^

##How to apply

s1. Contact your local authority or [local family information service](http://www.daycaretrust.org.uk/nafis "contact details for the family information service"){:rel="external"} and arrange to attend a pre-registration briefing for 'Early Years' applicants.
s2. [Download the guide to registration from Ofsted (PDF, 330KB).](http://www.ofsted.gov.uk/sites/default/files/documents/registration-forms-and-guides/g/Guide%20to%20registration%20on%20the%20Childcare%20Register.pdf "Download the guide to registration from Ofsted")
s3. [Apply online at the Ofsted website.](https://online.ofsted.gov.uk/OnlineOfsted/default.aspx "apply online at the Ofsted website"){:rel="external"} 

If you can’t apply online, contact Ofsted

$C**Ofsted**  
0300 123 1231  
Monday to Friday, 8am to 6:45pm
$C 

It costs £35 to apply.

##After you've applied

Once you've submitted your application Ofsted will: 

* check your references
* carry out checks on you with your doctor, your local authority and the [Criminal Records Bureau (CRB)](/crb-criminal-records-bureau-check "Getting a Criminal Records Bureau check"), 
* do some checks on anyone else who will be living or working at the home
* inspect the home 

##Getting your registration
If your application is approved, you will receive a certificate that shows you're a registered childminder. This usually takes between 2 and 3 months.

##Displaying your certificate
You must keep your certificate of registration - or a copy of it - where it can be easily seen. 

##Fines and penalties
If you don’t register as a childminder, you can be fined £5,000, sent to prison, or both.
